<br>

This is an attempt to curate  my favorite resources for learning data science with R. 
The organization is as follows:

* libraries,
* ebook,
* courses,
* readings/tutorials.


<br>


In this website I reported my resources collection ispired by the following website/posts:

* [Quick list of useful R packages](https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/201057987-Quick-list-of-useful-R-packages?mobile_site=true)
* [Great R packages for data import, wrangling and visualization](https://www.computerworld.com/article/2921176/business-intelligence/great-r-packages-for-data-import-wrangling-visualization.html)
* [R resources (free courses, books, tutorials, & cheat sheets)](https://paulvanderlaken.com/2017/08/10/r-resources-cheatsheets-tutorials-books/)
* [Top 20 R Libraries for Data Science in 2018 ](https://activewizards.com/blog/top-20-r-libraries-for-data-science-in-2018-infographic/)
* [Data Science Links](http://jasdumas.com/ds-resources/)
* [AWESOME R](https://awesome-r.com/)
* [Top R libraries for Data Science](https://medium.com/@Mr.dhariwal/top-r-libraries-for-data-science-9b24f658e243)
* [100 FREE TUTORIALS FOR LEARNING R](https://www.listendata.com/p/r-programming-tutorials.html)
* [An awesome sparklyr related package collection](https://github.com/harryprince/awesome-sparklyr)
